title: Terms and conditions
paragraph1: By using this service you’re agreeing to the following terms of use. This includes the privacy policy.
whoWeAreParagraph1: This service is managed by Her Majesty’s Courts and Tribunals service.
whoWeAreParagraph2: You should check these terms and conditions regularly. We may update them at any time without notice. If you continue to use this service after the terms and conditions have changed, you are deemed to have agreed to the changes.
informationProvidedParagraph1: This service provides information to support your application. We cannot give legal advice on individual cases.
informationProvidedParagraph2: You should answer the questions in the service based on your circumstances, and seek legal advice if you need it.
dataSharingStoringParagraph1: Our privacy policy explains where your data is stored, and who it is shared with.
dataSharingStoringParagraph2: Our cookie policy explains how this service uses and stores cookies.
lawsApplicableParagraph1: Your use of this service and any dispute arising from its use will be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of England and Wales, including but not limited to the:
responsibleUseHeading: How to use this service responsibly
responsibleUseParagraph1: There are risks in using a shared computer (for example, in a library) to access this service. It’s your responsibility to be aware of these risks and to avoid using any computer which may leave your personal information accessible to others. You’re responsible if you choose to leave a computer unprotected while using this service.
responsibleUseParagraph2: You should take your own precautions to ensure that the way you access this service does not expose you to the risk of:
responsibleUse-item3: other forms of interference which may damage your computer system
responsibleUseParagraph3: You must not misuse this service by knowingly introducing viruses, trojans, worms, logic bombs or other material which is malicious or technologically harmful. You must not attempt to gain unauthorised access to this service, the system on which it is stored, or any server, computer or database connected to it. You must not attack this site using a denial-of-service attack or a distributed denial-of-service attack.
personalInformationParagraph1: This online service contains several free-text fields in which you may choose to enter information which is personally sensitive.
personalInformationParagraph2: If you enter information about your:
personalInformationParagraph3: You give us your consent to processing this information for the purpose of dealing with your application.
personalInformationParagraph4: For more information about how we collect and store your personal data, see the privacy policy.
disclaimerParagraph1: While we make every effort to keep GOV.UK up to date, we don’t provide any guarantees, conditions or warranties that the information will be:
disclaimerParagraph2: We don’t publish advice on GOV.UK. You should get professional or specialist advice before doing anything on the basis of the content.
disclaimerParagraph3: We’re not liable for any loss or damage that may come from using GOV.UK. This includes:
disclaimer-item6: any direct, indirect or consequential losses
disclaimer-item7: any loss or damage caused by civil wrongs (‘tort’, including negligence), breach of contract or otherwise
disclaimer-item8: the use of GOV.UK and any websites that are linked to or from it
disclaimer-item9: the inability to use GOV.UK and any websites that are linked to or from it
disclaimerParagraph4: This applies if the loss or damage was foreseeable, arose in the normal course of things or you advised us that it might happen.
disclaimerParagraph5: This includes (but isn’t limited to) the loss of your:
disclaimer-item18: intangible property, including loss, corruption or damage to data or any computer system
disclaimerParagraph6: We may still be liable for:
disclaimer-item20: death or personal injury arising from our negligence
disclaimer-item22: any other liability which cannot be excluded or limited under applicable law
contactParagraph3: Find out about call charges (opens in a new window)
